title: Hydrocortison 10G Cream
details: Hydrocortisone is a medicated cream that belongs to a group of the topical corticosteroid; the cream used to treat various skin diseases and skin problems or allergic reactions. This cream has steroids properties, so it relieves the skin problem rap READ MORE
precautions: Tell your doctor/Pharmacist if you are allergic to it, or to other Corticosteroids (e.g., Prednisone, Triamcinolone); or if you have any other allergies.There are following precautions for the Hydrocortisone Cream.PregnancyIn the condition of pregnancy, the usage of Hydrocortisone Cream, without the recommendation of the doctor, maybe dangerous so take consultation from the doctor.BreastfeedingNo history of contraindications to breastfeeding women but before using Hydrocortisone Cream, take consultation from the doctor.DrivingNo effect of hydrocortisone cream on driving.Expiry dateAlways check the expiry date before you take the hydrocortisone cream.HypersensitivityWhen the doctor prescribed hydrocortisone cream then mention it to your doctor if you are allergic to it.General precautionsKeep outreach from childrenPlace it at room temperature not more than 25 celsius.Protect from the direct sunlight.For external use only.Apply carefully cream in anal and genital.After applying the cream if your allergies get worse then stop using it, and consult your doctor.
effects: StingingIrritationDryness on the skinSkin thinningDifficulty in breathingUnusual hair growthStretch marksIncrease sweatingAcne breakoutBurningRednessAcne, Unusual hair growth, Folliculitis, Skin thinning/Discoloration, or Stretch marks may also occur.

title: Clobederm 10MG Cream
details:
Clobederm cream is used for a variety of skin problems. The generic name of this cream is Clobetasol Propionate, which is also an active ingredient in it. The therapeutic Category of the cream is Dermatological.

Uses
Clobederm
READ MORE
precautions: Precautions Before using the medication, it is very important to consult a doctor and share the medical history and any current health condition like pregnancy or any diseases.Patient who are hypersensitive should be careful while using the cream as it contains an active ingredient which may cause serious allergic problems.The cream is used on the skin only; it should not be used for inner parts of the body; it is only for external use.Do not use it on the groin, face, or underarms unless it is advised by the doctor. Keep it away from children.Use the cream just for the condition recommended. Try not to use it for more than 50 grams in a week as by directed by the doctor, and do not use more than two weeks straight.The cream should not be applied on the areas if there is a sore present or an infection to be treated.Do not use this cream for diaper rash, and avoid getting this cream in the mouth, eyes, and nose.The cream should not be used in large amounts or more quantity than required. Avoid using it on the damaged skin.
effects: Every medicine has its side effects, but it is not important that it occurs every time, but it may occur. Some of the side effects are rare, but some are very serious.Some of the side effects which may occur are the: Irritation of the skinDryness of the skinPatches on the skinRedness of the skinBurning of skinStingingAcneStretch marksIncreasing of hair growthThe redness and the dryness may occur when it is first time applied to the skin. However, this ought to vanish in few days as the body adjusts to the cream.In case any of these effects get worse, or it gets bad, it is important to consult a doctor.

title: Hydrocortison 5G Cream
details: This medication is used to treat a variety of skin conditions, e.g., Insect bites, Poison oak/ivy, Eczema, Dermatitis, Allergies, Rash, Itching of the outer female genitals, Anal itching. It reduces the Swelling, Itching, and Redness that can occur READ MORE
precautions: Tell your doctor/Pharmacist if you are allergic to it, or to other Corticosteroids (e.g., Prednisone, Triamcinolone); or if you have any other allergies.
effects: Stinging, Burning, Irritation, Dryness, or Redness at the application site may occur. Acne, Unusual hair growth, Folliculitis, Skin thinning/Discoloration, or Stretch marks may also occur.

Uses

This medication treats skin infections like impetigo or o

READ MORE
precautions: The antibiotics gentamicin and amikacin are both aminoglycoside antibiotics, meaning they interact with ribosomes. If you have any allergic reactions to gentamicin, amikacin, or another aminoglycoside antibiotic, tell your doctor before using the antibiotic. People who are allergic to certain inactive ingredients or react badly to them might have an adverse reaction to this product. Learn more by talking to your pharmacist.
effects: Following are some side effects that might happen after using this cream. If they become worse or you notice an increase in your problem, tell your doctor soon.These skin issues may include skin irritation, redness, and itching. Tell your doctor or pharmacist if any of these effects persist or worsen.Loosening of skin when applying this medication.Unexpected hair growing.A very serious skin allergy from this cream is rare, but it mostly depends on one's medical condition, but still, one should consult medical help if one of these allergies show up.Swelling on the applied area.Itchy feel on the skin.Having trouble while breathingThe use of this medication over an extended period of time may lead to the development of skin infections other than those for which it was prescribed (such as fungal or other bacterial infections). If you notice any unusual skin symptoms or if your condition does not improve, be sure to contact your doctor.

formula:
Betamethasone Dipropionate and Gentamycin, Topical
Saffron
details:
Provate G Cream is a drug used to treat different kinds of skin diseases. Redness, swelling, and itching reduce inflammatory symptoms. It also has antimicrobial activity against microorganisms that trigger infection and fight against them. <

READ MORE
precautions: Discuss with your doctor if you are allergic from the antibiotics, including neomycin, polymyxin, gentamycin, or from any corticosteroids, because this medication includes inactive ingredients, which can cause severe allergies to the skin.It should only be used when needed the most during the pregnancy period as it is not known and is also not known that the product might pass the maternal milk before breastfeeding; it is better to consult a doctor before.Patients using this medication with the prescription and directions of the doctor might be aware of possible drug interaction depending on their medical condition; patients changing or stopping the dosage may consult their doctor before doing it.Whenever the skin is damaged and stitches have been applied, there is always a risk for infection in the wound. Therefore creams and ointments, which include antibiotics like bacitracin, are always used to reduce the bacteria from the wound.It is made with a combination of three antibiotics which include bacitracin which doctors mainly prescribe and apply on stitches which helps in the reduction and prevention of bacteria in the wound.
effects: This cream reduces bacteria in bacterial infections caused by minor injuries there; it also has many side effects which can affect an individual in a negative way, depending on one’s medical and physical condition.Burn spots of skin after applying the medication.Redness in the skin.Irritation in the skin.Skin getting dry depends on skin condition.If any serious side effects are caused by this medication, should immediately consult medical help as this medication is given for benefit purposes, not to increase the risk of side effects. Some rare and serious problems that might occur areBurn spots after applying it on the skin.Instant hair bumps after applying the cream (Folliculitis).Appearing of acne on the skin.Loosening of skin when applying this medication.Unexpected hair growing.A very serious skin allergy from this cream is rare, but it mostly depends on one’s medical condition, but still, one should consult medical help if one of these allergies show up.Swelling on the applied area.Itchy feel on the skin.Having trouble while breathing.Dizziness feeling.

title: Clobevate 20G Cream
details:
Skin disorders are becoming common due to environmental pollution, seasonal allergies, situational causes, stress, disturbed sleep-wake cycle, or it could be genetic. Treatment of various skin conditions such as eczema, psoriasis, dermatitis, or

READ MORE
precautions: Some necessary precautions should be taken while using Clobevate cream.Read and follow the instructions carefully written in the manual of the leaflet that comes with the medicine. This medicine is used TOPICALLY on the skin only. It should not get into your mouth, nose, eyes, or groin area. If it does, rinse it with plenty of water. Do not use it on skin areas that have been cut or wounded. Do not use Clobevate cream in excess. Do not use this cream for a longer time than your doctor advised. If any irritation, harmful side effects, or unwanted reactions occur, make sure to consult your doctor immediately. Do not discontinue using this medicine if your doctor has not advised you to stop the treatment. Take the full treatment. Do not miss any dose. Do not bandage or wrap the skin being treated with this medicine.
effects: Along with many beneficial uses of Clobevate cream, it has a few side effects that have been reported in a few patients. Side effects of Clobevate cream areItching sensationBurning sensation on the skinSkin rashFlaking or drynessFormation of dry, scaly patchesRedness or rash may appear.Soreness or swelling may occur.If it goes in the eyes, it may cause blurred vision.It may also cause facial hair growth in females if applied to facial skin.

title: Betaderm 60ML Lotion
details:

precautions: This lotion can be purchased without the prescription, but in case of serious skin conditions such as psoriasis and dermatitis, etc., it is advisable to talk to the doctor before using the lotion.It is used on the external side only. Do not apply the lotion on sensitive areas such as genitals or under the eyes.People with diabetes, immune system issues and blood circulation problems must inform the doctor before using this product.Long-term usage of this product makes your skin less responsive to physical stress and pain.Pregnant women must only use this product when it is clearly needed.It is contraindicated in patients with known hypersensitivity to the drug.
effects: Betaderm lotion is a steroid. It should not be used excessively. Likewise, for every other ointment, this ointment also has some side effects. In case any of the side effects persist or worsens, immediately seek medical assistance. Thinning of the skin due to excessive use of the medication.Stretch marks and discolouration of the skin.The appearance of acne in some cases.The unwanted hair growth or ingrown hairsThis medication may make the skin infections worse in some cases.Weight loss due to extremely severe allergic reaction from the ointment.Swelling of feet or hands.Headache and tirednessIncreased thirst and dryness of mouthBlurred visionFrequent urination or dark-colored urine.Burning and itchiness on the affected area.

Your doctor/pharmacist may suggest that you limit your time in the sun, avoid tanning booths and sunlamps, and use sunscreen and wear protective clothing when outdoors. This product may contain inactive ingredients, which can cause allergic reactions or other problems. Talk to your pharmacist for more details. Discontinue if irritation and sensitization observed during use. Apply enough medication to cover the affected area and some of the surrounding skin. After applying this medication, wash your hands unless you are using this medication to treat the hands. Do not wrap, cover or bandage the area unless directed to do so by your doctor. If used in the diaper area on an infant, do not use tight-fitting diapers or plastic pants. Continue to use this medication until the full prescribed amount is finished, even if symptoms disappear after starting nystatin. Stopping the medication too early may allow the fungus to continue to grow, which may result in a return of the infection. Ask your pharmacist or healthcare provider before using any medicine

effects: Please Consult Your Pharmacist or Physician

title: Zovirax 10G Cream
details: It is used to treat infections caused by certain types of viruses. It treats cold sores around the mouth (caused by herpes simplex), shingles (caused by herpes zoster), and chickenpox.
precautions: Use With Caution while having other allergies.
effects: Temporary burning or stinging when you apply it, Rashes, Itching.

title: Liquid Parafin 50ML Oil 1x10 (L)
details: Please Consult Your Pharmacist or Physician
precautions: Please Consult Your Pharmacist or Physician
effects: Please Consult Your Pharmacist or Physician

title: Daivobet 15G Oint
formula:
Calcipotriol and Betamethasone, Topical
Leo Pharma
details: It is used mainly for psoriasis.
precautions: Before taking it , tell your doctor or pharmacist if you are allergic to it; or if you have any other allergies. This product may contain inactive ingredients (such as peanut/soy), which can cause allergic reactions or other problems. Talk to your pharmacist for more details. When used on other sites, wash hands carefully to reduce the chance of inadvertent application to the face. To make sure it is safe for you, tell your doctor if you are receiving phototherapy (light treatments) for your psoriasis. It should be use with caution in patient who are more prone to allergies. Ask your dermatologist before using it.
effects: Skin thinning or discoloration, stretch marks, "hair bumps" (folliculitis) and peeling around the edge of the plaques.

title: Acetin 25MG Cap 3x10 (L)
details: This medication is a retinoid used in the treatment of severe psoriasis and other skin disorders in adults
precautions: Before taking acitretin, tell your doctor or pharmacist if you are allergic to it; or to vitamin A-related drugs (other retinoids such as isotretinoin); or if you have any other allergies. This product may contain inactive ingredients, which can cause allergic reactions or other problems. Talk to your pharmacist for more details. Do not donate blood while taking this drug and for at least 3 years after stopping therapy. This will prevent the possibility of your blood being given to a pregnant woman. Before using this medication, tell your doctor or pharmacist your medical history, especially of kidney disease, liver disease, heart disease, diabetes, personal or family history of mental/mood problems (such as depression), receive phototherapy.
effects: You may experience more redness, itching, skin scaling, peeling and dry skin the first several weeks as your body adjusts to the medication. Dry eyes, eye irritation, crusting of the eye lids, dry mouth, peeling of the skin of fingertips, palms or soles of feet, chapped lips, runny nose, thirst, taste changes and hair loss may also occur. If any of these effects persist or worsen, tell your doctor or pharmacist promptly. Contact lens wearers may be uncomfortable while taking this drug because it causes dry eyes.
